title: Dasht-e Kevir (Great Salt Desert, Iran)
description:
The Dasht-e Kevir, or Great Salt Desert, is the largest desert in Iran. It is primarily uninhabited wasteland, composed of mud and salt marshes covered with crusts of salt that protect the meager moisture from completely evaporating.
This is a false-color composite image made using infrared, green, and red wavelengths. The image has also been sharpened using the sensor’s panchromatic band.
theme:
FALSE – COLOR. Satellites show what human
eyes can't see
